p: Climatic niche expansion (within the invasive range, but outside of the native one) was 0.189 ± 0.130 in the invasive range ( A. retroflexus with the largest expansion and lowest niche stability and G. parviflora with the least expansion and highest niche stability; Table 1). The average climatic niche breadth of the AIWs based on the invasive ranges, native ranges, and combined invasive and native ranges were 0.284 ± 0.046, 0.142 ± 0121, and 0.313 ± 0.077, respectively, and the ENMs differed significantly among these range classes ( t‐test, p < .001; Table S4), indicating that the AIWs had larger climatic niche breadths in the invasive ranges than the native ranges.
